description:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Optical Transport Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.

The Optical Engineering and Operations team maintains, audits, troubleshoots and repairs Google's global fiber optic network. Our fiber optic dense wavelength division multiplexing network interconnects data centers and Internet Service Providers worldwide. We keep the network running while focussing on automation of tasks.

As an Optical Transport Engineer for the Production Networking team, you will work with other network engineers and teams in Google to ensure the smooth operation of our optical networking platforms on the Google production network. You will also work closely with Deployment Engineers to review service information from the field and compare against expected results. The objective of the Network Transport Engineering group is to maintain the most reliable and cost-effective optical network.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Experience with optical theory and transport technologies and optical transport DWDM systems operations.
  • Experience scripting/programming.
  • 2 years of experience in optical network installation, maintenance and operation for service providers or enterprise networks.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to travel.
  • Experience in optical network design, installation and maintenance for service providers or large enterprise networks.
responsibilities:
• Work as second-line support for all optical issues across the global network of all production installed transport devices. Perform on-call rotation duties as required.
  • Facilitate the first-line support team by actively seeking out and automating recurring transactional tasks.
  • Develop test plans and automation for optical physical-layer, transceiver, transponder, and line-systems.
  • Develop tools and processes for automation of acceptance proactively, operational, troubleshooting, and network health reporting.
  • Work with network design, deployment, and engineering teams to operationalize stable, scalable platforms.
title: Optical Transport Engineer, Operations
